column4: hmm  strange I created a test.php that has <?php phpinfo(); ?> now when I go to localhost/test.php it asks me to saves the attachment.
should i be asking these questions here of php channel?
what does sudo a2enmod php5 do?
sorry i'm usign to just using xampp
what about mysql?
does it install is aswell?
i tried a2enmod php5 it recons php5 module already enabled
i tried a2enmod php5 it recons php5 module already enabled
but its still asking me to download the php file
is this apache? try chmod -R 755 /var/www
it is apache. I can open localhost and get the repsonse "its working"
what does chmod -R 755 /var/www do?
it just changes the permissions so you can see the pages. sorry, I didn't hear you original question. you might have to add index.php to /etc/apache2/sites-available/default
correction, /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/dir.conf (just checked)
just make sure index.php is on the DireectoryIndex line
there is already a index.html in /vars/www
add index.php to it
when i open localhost in firefox i get confirmation that apache is working
ok i create a index.php and it did not ask me to download but the files has no content
that's because you don't have an index.php in /var/www. you can change the index.html to index.php and it should work
my dir.conf has this line DirectoryIndex index.html index.cgi index.pl index.php index.xhtml index.htm
my dir.conf has those
can i msg u instead?
